name: solitary fairies

attributes.attribute: miserly fairy shoemaker who hid his wealth away

sources: Briggs, Katernine M. An Encyclopedia of Fairies: Hobgoblins, Brownies, Bogies, and Other Supernatural Creatures. New York: Pantheon Books, 1976, 375–376.
Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Folkloric figures known as solitary fairies are found in both Irish and Scottish folklore. They were categorized into two types: Trooping Fairies, who enjoyed socializing and celebrating with their own kind, and the ill-natured solitary fairies who preferred to spend their time alone. The miserly Leprechaun, a fairy shoemaker famous for hoarding his wealth, was the most well-known solitary fairy, while the cautious Cluricaune was another.
